Question Feedback

Increasing vault cash levels that do not correlate to bank needs indicate a potential defalcation.

 

Signs that a bank insider is living beyond their means may include expensive clothes, jewelry, or travel. A review of the teller's employee deposit account may have revealed this.

 

At a bank with few employees, single-custody access by a head teller is fairly common. However, more thorough vault cash counts would have detected the problem.
